current.abandon_text: You can abandon the ongoing/scheduled trial anytime you wish. Please note that upon doing so, if you wish to remain in the study you will have to setup a new trial and reschedule your exit interview date.
current.submit_cant: Please enter breakfast compliance and symptom report(s) before submitting the daily report.

calendar.noreport: No report was logged for the day.

no_study.title: No ongoing study
no_study.subtitle: Would you like to setup your study?

neg_compliance.title: Oh no!
neg_compliance.text: You can still finish your study - just be careful to follow the schedule for the remaining days. If you miss an additional day, you will have to restart the study.

pos_compliance.title: Great job!
pos_compliance.text: Remember, do not consume any food or beverage (other than water) for the next 3 hours. You will reminded to log your symptom severity level after 3 hours.

post.title: Symptom Level for {DAY}
post.subtitle: At its worst, how much has {SYMPTOM} impacted your day?

likertlabels.label: Slightly
likertlabels.detail: only noticed my symptom when I focused on it

likertlabels.label: Mildly
likertlabels.detail: I could ignore my symptom most of the time

likertlabels.label: Moderately
likertlabels.detail: could continue what I was doing

likertlabels.label: Severely
likertlabels.detail: had difficulty concentrating on some tasks

likertlabels.label: Very severely
likertlabels.detail: had difficulty concentrating on any task

pasttrial.label: Abdominal Pain
pasttrial.result: Based on the study, there is no evidence that your abdominal pain decreases when you don't eat lactose (p=0.762).

results.summary: Based on the trial, there is {EVIDENCE} evidence that your {SYMPTOM} gets {BETTER/WORSE} when you consume {TRIGGER}

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: If you did not find what you are looking for please reach out to us.

list.faq: What are various symptoms for IBS?
How to choose a trigger to test?
What is the symptom severity scale?
How do we define Abdominal Pain?
How do we define Bowel Urgency?
Need help deciding what to eat?
What is the meaning of life?

pvalue.title: What is a p-value?
pvalue.para1: The p-value of your study represents the probability of the result being true.
pvalue.para10: A p-value of 0.06 means there is possible evidence that the trigger you are testing in the trial can be causing your symptoms.

abdominalpain.title: How do we define Abdominal Pain?
abdominalpain.para1: The amount of pain or discomfort (uncomfortable sensation) you feel anywhere between your chest and groin.
abdominalpain.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
abdominalpain.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

bloating.title: How do we define Bloating / Gas?
bloating.para1: How full and tight your belly feels and/or how much gas (burping/farting) you are experiencing.
bloating.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
bloating.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

urgency.title: How do we define Bowel Urgency?
urgency.para1: How sudden or pressing it feels like you need to have a bowel movement.
urgency.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
urgency.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

diarrhea.title: How do we define Diarrhea?
diarrhea.para1: How frequent and/or loose your stools are.
diarrhea.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
diarrhea.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

constipation.title: How do we define Constipation?
constipation.para1: How backed up you feel and/or how hard the passage of stool is.
constipation.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
constipation.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

triggerchoice.title: How to choose a trigger to test?
triggerchoice.para1: It's best to choose something that you eat or do often, but aren't sure whether it affects you.
triggerchoice.para2: Avoid testing triggers that you are confident will make your symptoms worse. You may choose only one factor to test at a time.

settings.clear_explanation: This will clear your stored username and password. You'll be prompted to enter them again later.
settings.demo_explanation: This will begin an accelerated demo of the most recently created trial. This is for demonstration purposes only. Do not do this for a genuine trial!

setup.title: Setup a new trial
setup.content:
This setup will guide you through the steps to create your own self trial. A trial helps you figure out whether a nutrient affects your symptoms for IBS. 

During the trial, you will be asked to eat certain nutrients on some mornings and avoid that nutrient on other mornings. 

We will help you track your progress and symptoms by sending you daily reminders.

setup3.title: 2. Choose a possible cause
setup3.subtitle: Which of the following food items is a likely cause for your symptoms?

triggers.phrase_plus: eat at least 8 grams of lactose

setup3_1.title: 2.1 Testing impact of Sorbitol / Artificial Sweeteners
setup3_1.para1: On select days you will be asked to eat at least 5 grams of sorbitol during your breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 5 grams on these days.
setup3_1.para2: On select days you will be asked not to eat sorbitol during your breakfast. It is ok if you eat less than 0.5 gram on these days
setup3_1.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_1.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_1.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_2.title: 2.2 Testing Lactose / Dairy Consumption
setup3_2.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_2.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_2.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_2.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_2.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_3.title: 2.3 Testing impact of drinking Caffeine
setup3_3.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_3.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_3.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_3.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_3.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_4.title: 2.4 Testing impact of eating Gluten
setup3_4.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_4.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_4.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_4.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_4.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup4.title: 3. Set start date and reminders
setup4.subtitle: When do you want to begin the study and when do you want to receive reminder notifications?
setup4.morning_text: You will be sent a reminder to follow the study schedule for each day. Choose a time, perhaps a little before breakfast.
setup4.breakfast_text: You will be sent a reminder to log whether you followed the study schedule correctly during your breakfast meal. Choose a time a little after breakfast.
setup4.symptom_text: Later, you will be sent a reminder to log the severity of your symptoms. Choose a time at least 3 hours after breakfast but before lunch.
setup4.evening_text: You will receive one final reminder for the day to make changes to any of your responses. Choose a time in the evening, preferably before your dinner.
setup4.study_length_text: A longer study will produce results that are more likely to be accurate.
setup4.start_date_text: Select the date on which you would like to begin your trial. Remember, you will be asked to follow a specific breakfast for the duration of the trial.

setup4b.title: 4. Set Food Preferences
setup4b.breakfast_text: Select a breakfast food and drink you can consistently eat for the duration of the trial. You must have access to the recommended meals for every day of the trial.

condition.Cereal:
Have your usual bowl of cereal your usual way and add at least one of the following: 
 - 10 prunes (5 g) 
 - Four sugar-free candies like lifesavers or mints (> 5 g) 
 - Two pieces of sugar-free gum (4 g) 
 - A glass of apple juice (3 g and equivalent amounts of fructose and glucose)
condition.Yogurt:
Eat at least 5 oz of yogurt and add at least one of the following:
 - 10 prunes (5 g)
 - Four sugar-free candies like lifesavers or mints (> 5 g)
 - Two pieces of sugar-free gum (4 g)
 - A glass of apple juice (3 g and equivalent amounts of fructose and glucose)
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel):
Eat your usual toast (bread, english muffin or bagel) and add at least one of the following: 
 - Sugar-free fruit jams or spreads
 - 10 prunes (5 g)
 - Four sugar-free candies like lifesavers or mints (> 5 g)
 - Two pieces of sugar-free gum (4 g)
 - A glass of apple juice (3 g and equivalent amounts of fructose and glucose)
condition.Muffin:
Eat your usual muffin and add at least one of the following:
 - Sugar-free fruit jams or spreads
 - 10 prunes (5 g)
 - Four sugar-free candies like lifesavers or mints (> 5 g)
 - Two pieces of sugar-free gum (4 g)
 - A glass of apple juice (3 g and equivalent amounts of fructose and glucose)
condition.Waffle/Pancake:
Eat your usual waffle/pancake and add at least one of the following:
 - Sugar-free fruit jams or spreads
 - 10 prunes (5 g)
 - Four sugar-free candies like lifesavers or mints (> 5 g)
 - Two pieces of sugar-free gum (4 g)
 - A glass of apple juice (3 g and equivalent amounts of fructose and glucose)
condition.Specialty Drink:
Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink. 
Okay to add any dairy or sweeteners to your drink
condition.Tea:
Drink your usual tea.
Okay to add any dairy or sweeteners to your drink

condition.Cereal:
Have your usual bowl of cereal the usual way but make sure it is not labeled "sugar-free" and avoid adding any:
 - Apples
 - Apricots
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 - Prunes
 - Plums
 - Watermelon
condition.Yogurt:
Eat at least 5 oz of yogurt but make sure it is not labeled "sugar-free" and avoid the following flavors:
 - Apples
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 Also avoid adding any artificial sweeteners except for table sugar
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel):
Eat your usual breakfast but avoid the following fruit jams/spreads:
 - Sugar-free
 - Apples
 - Apricots
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 - Prunes
 - Plums
 - Watermelon
 Also avoid adding any artificial sweetners aside from table sugar.
condition.Muffin:
Eat your usual muffin but make sure it is not labeled "sugar-free." Avoid any muffins or adding jams/spreads containing the following:
 - Sugar-free ingredients
 - Apples
 - Apricots
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 - Prunes
 - Plums
 - Watermelon
 Also avoid adding any artificial sweetners aside from table sugar.
condition.Waffle/Pancake:
Eat your usual waffle/pancake but make sure it is not labeled "sugar-free." Avoid any pancakes/waffles or adding jams/spreads containing the following:
 - Sugar-free ingredients
 - Apples
 - Apricots
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 - Prunes
 - Plums
 - Watermelon
 Also avoid adding any artificial sweetners aside from table sugar.
condition.Coffee/Espresso:
Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink.
If you add any dairy to your drink, avoid non-dairy creamers.
 If you add any sweeteners, only use table or brown sugar.
condition.Specialty Drink:
Drink your usual specialty drink.
If you add any dairy to your drink, avoid non-dairy creamers.
If you add any sweeteners, only use table or brown sugar.
condition.Tea:
Drink your usual tea.
If you add any dairy to your drink, avoid non-dairy creamers.
If you add any sweeteners, only use table or brown sugar.
condition.Milk: Drink your usual milk but make sure it is unflavored and avoid adding any sweeteners except for table sugar
condition.Energy Drink: Drink your usual drink but make sure it not labeled "sugar-free, diet or light/lite."
condition.Soda: Drink your usual drink but make sure it not labeled "sugar-free, diet or light/lite."
condition.Juice:
Drink your usual juices but make sure it not labeled "sugar-free, diet or light/lite."
Avoid the following flavors:
 - Apples
 - Apricots
 - Pears
 - Nectarines
 - Blackberries
 - Prunes
 - Plums
 - Watermelon

condition.Cereal: Use at least 6 oz of cow's milk with your bowl of cereal.
condition.Yogurt: Eat at least 5 oz of cow's milk yogurt (this is most non-Greek yogurts!)
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel): Drink at least 6 oz of cow’s milk with your usual breakfast.
condition.Muffin: Drink at least 6 oz of cow’s milk with your usual breakfast.
condition.Waffle/Pancake: Drink at least 6 oz of cow’s milk with your usual breakfast.
condition.Coffee/Espresso:
Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink.
Okay to add any dairy to your drink
condition.Specialty Drink:
Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink.
Okay to add any dairy to your drink
condition.Tea:
Drink your usual tea.
Okay to add any dairy to your drink
condition.Milk: Drink at least 6 oz of cow's milk (if not already prompted to do so with meal prompt).

condition.Cereal: Use at least 6 oz of any lactose-free milks with your cereal such as: lactose-free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp, or lactaid-treated milk.
condition.Yogurt: Eat at least 5 oz of any specifically labeled lactose-free yogurts.
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel):
Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any lactose-containing spreads such as:
 - Cheeses or cheese spreads
 - Cream-based spreads
 - Butters

 AND

 Drink at least 6 oz of any lactose-free milk with your breakfast: lactose, free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Muffin:
Avoid any muffins with glazes, cheese, or cream fillings.

AND

Drink at least 6 oz of any lactose-free milk with your breakfast: lactose, free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Waffle/Pancake:
Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any lactose-containing spreads such as:
 - Cheeses or cheese spreads
 - Butter
 - Whipped cream

AND

Drink at least 6 oz of any lactose-free milk with your breakfast: lactose, free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Coffee/Espresso:
Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink.
If you add any milk to your drink, use a lactose-free containing one such as: lactose-free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Specialty Drink:
Drink your usual specialty drink without cow's milk.
If the drink base is milk, use a lactose-free containing one such as: lactose-free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Tea:
Drink your usual tea.
If you add any milk to your drink, use a lactose-free containing one such as: lactose-free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp
condition.Milk: Drink at least 6 oz of lactose-free milk containing one such as: lactose-free, almond, rice, coconut, hemp.

condition.Coffee/Espresso: Drink your usual coffee/espresso drink, of at least of medium-strength brew.
condition.Milk: In addition to your milk, drink either 1 cup of medium-brewed coffee/espresso or strongly brewed black tea.
condition.Soda: Drink at least 12 ounces of the following caffeine containing sodas: Coke, Diet Coke, Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, Dr. Pepper, Diet Dr. Pepper.
condition.Juice: In addition to your juice, drink either 1 cup of medium-brewed coffee/espresso or strongly brewed black tea.
condition.Water: In addition to your water, drink either 1 cup of medium-brewed coffee/espresso or strongly brewed black tea.

condition.Cereal: Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any chocolate, cocoa, or coffee flavored/containing foods.
condition.Yogurt: Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any chocolate, cocoa, or coffee flavored/containing foods.
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel): Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any chocolate, cocoa, or coffee flavored/containing foods.
condition.Muffin: Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any chocolate, cocoa, or coffee flavored/containing foods.
condition.Waffle/Pancake: Eat your usual breakfast but avoid any chocolate, cocoa, or coffee flavored/containing foods.
condition.Coffee/Espresso: Drink the decaffeinated version of your usual coffee/espresso drink.
condition.Specialty Drink: Drink the decaffeinated version of your usual specialty drink.
condition.Energy Drink: Drink the decaffeinated version of your energy drink or substitute it with pure fruit juice (only if can't find).
condition.Soda: Drink at least 12 ounces of the following caffeine-free  sodas: Root Beer, Sprite, Diet Sprite, Sierra Mist, Diet Sierra Mist, 7UP, Diet 7UP.

condition.Cereal:
Have your regular portion of gluten-containing cereal such as:
 - Mini Wheats (any variety)
 - Raisin Bran
 - Honey Bunches of Oats
condition.Yogurt:
Have your regular portion of yogurt

AND

Add at least 1/4 cup of a gluten-containing cereal such as:
-Mini Wheats (any variety)
-Raisin Bran
-Cheerios
-Honey Bunches of Oats.
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel): Eat your usual gluten-containing toast (bread, english muffin or bagel) with any spread or additions you like. Make sure it is not labeled gluten-free.
condition.Muffin: Eat your usual gluten-containing muffin.  Make sure it is not labeled gluten-free.
condition.Waffle/Pancake: Eat your usual gluten-containing waffle/pancake.  Make sure it is not labeled gluten-free.

condition.Cereal:
Have your regular portion of gluten-free labeled cereal such as:
 - Cheerios
 - General Mills Rice or Corn Chex
 - Nature's Path Organic Whole O's
 - Glutino's Corn and Rice Flakes
 - Cocoa Pebbles
 - Fruity Pebbles
 - Cream of Rice
 - Oatmeal
 - Grits
 - Rice Krispies
condition.Yogurt: Have your regular portion of yogurt.
condition.Toast (Bread, english muffin, bagel):
Eat gluten-free toast (bread, english muffin or bagel). Make sure it is labeled gluten-free.

Okay to add any gluten-free spreads, fruits or additives. For bottled products, make sure it is labeled gluten-free.
condition.Muffin:
Eat a gluten-free labeled muffin.

Okay to add any gluten-free spreads or additives. For bottled products, make sure it is labeled gluten-free.
condition.Waffle/Pancake:
Eat a gluten-free labeled waffle/pancake.

Okay to add any gluten-free spreads, fruits or additives.  For bottled products, make sure it is labeled gluten-free.

setup6.subtitle: Great. You are all set. Remember, during the {{12}} days of your trial, you will need to have ingredients for {{breakfast}} and {{drink}}
setup6.para1: You will see instructions regarding your trial on the 'Current Trial' tab.
